lead_paragraph: The Detroit Tigers placed the left-handed pitcher Dontrelle Willis on the 15-day disabled list Sunday with an anxiety disorder and put reliever Joel Zumaya on the list with a sore right shoulder. Willis said he had been feeling well on and off the mound, but that doctors did not like something they saw in his blood. General Manager Dave Dombrowski said he could not provide details about Willis’s medical condition or treatment because of privacy regulations. The team said the Zumaya move was retroactive to March 27.
